abstract: Returns the index path of the cell containing the context’s next focused view.
overview:
## Discussion

This property returns the index path only when the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusUpdateContext/nextFocusedView] is located within a cell of the table view. Otherwise, it returns `nil`. This can happen if focus is moving out of the table view, because the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusUpdateContext/nextFocusedView] isn’t associated with an index path in this table view.

When focus is moving from one table view to another, each table view delegate is called with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewFocusUpdateContext/previouslyFocusedIndexPath] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewFocusUpdateContext/nextFocusedIndexPath] configured for its specific table view.

# nextFocusedIndexPath

**Instance Property**

Returns the index path of the cell containing the context’s next focused view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var nextFocusedIndexPath: IndexPath? { get }
```

## Discussion

This property returns the index path only when the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusUpdateContext/nextFocusedView] is located within a cell of the table view. Otherwise, it returns `nil`. This can happen if focus is moving out of the table view, because the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFocusUpdateContext/nextFocusedView] isn’t associated with an index path in this table view.

When focus is moving from one table view to another, each table view delegate is called with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewFocusUpdateContext/previouslyFocusedIndexPath] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewFocusUpdateContext/nextFocusedIndexPath] configured for its specific table view.

## Locating focusable items in a table view

- **previouslyFocusedIndexPath**: Returns the index path of the cell containing the context’s previously focused view.
